text: [Music]
my grandfather Peter he is profoundly
deaf and what we noticed I guess from
about 10 years ago is at Christmas when
we would go home and spend time with him
he was becoming increasingly withdrawn
he was just watching the TV he was
watching the subtitles on the TV and he
wasn't really engaging in any
conversations and we could just see that
he was kind of shrinking he was becoming
a shell of his former self what if we
could give him a pair of glasses and
subtitle conversations that was the
[Music]
idea we've been with x-ray glass from
when they first came up with their idea
immediately we started helping them out
with their transcribe and translate and
then gave them a healthy amount of
credits as well so they start testing
out our services I'm incredibly proud to
support them from a technical standpoint
we have gone through a series of
Workshop immersion days and after that
we came up to a solution that is
leveraging AWS Translate and transcribe
to make the world uh a more inclusive
place one word at a

time when we speak with um you know

I noticed not only that they know our

right they they can actually help us and

it's just been a really good experience
for us we are fully invested in helping

Specialists who are there to work

to create bespoke plans one of the

personally came to see me because he has
something to tell me to sh to share with

toe with smart glasses and as he was
talking to me the subtitles appears
right in front of my eyes as he was
talking to me at that point I was
completely blown away and at that point
my daughter had come into the kitchen
exped my name and started speaking to me
but St sometimes would came up without

when I just started to why because
that's never ever happened to me before
x-ray glass has just been an incredible
success story we've already got over
50,000 people signed up and and using
the platform we're looking now at where
we could go from here what if we could
have a Servo based model so at theaters
or events for example the presenter
could have x-ray glass and we could
stream the captions out over the
internet using AWS Services which means
all of the client devices don't need to
you know do redundant transcription and
redundant translation I think the future
is exciting and also the partnership
with AWS is really really good
